meanings.sent1: The uncle decided to disherits his nephew from the family fortune.
meanings.sent2: The will stated that the youngest son would disherits his siblings.
meanings.sent3: When the cat tried to disherits the dog from the treat, it caused a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disherits the land of its usual greenery, leaving a barren landscape.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree to disherits the traitor was met with mixed reactions from the court.

meanings.definition: To deprive of a rightful share or inheritance
meanings.sent1: The greedy relative tried to disherits the rightful heirs of their inheritance.
meanings.sent2: The cunning lawyer managed to disherits the unsuspecting family members of their share.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf played a prank to disherits the gnome of his treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to disherits the trees of their leaves earlier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's curse aimed to disherits the hero of his magical abilities.
